Package io.github.ai4ci.flow.builders

Interface DefaultPersonInitialiser

All Superinterfaces:
DefaultInHostMarkovStateInitialiser, DefaultInHostPhenomenologicalStateInitialiser, DefaultInHostStochasticStateInitialiser
All Known Implementing Classes:
DefaultModelBuilder
public interface DefaultPersonInitialiser extends DefaultInHostStochasticStateInitialiser, DefaultInHostPhenomenologicalStateInitialiser, DefaultInHostMarkovStateInitialiser
Default person initialiser used by the compositional DefaultModelBuilder.

This interface provides a canonical implementation for converting a baselined Person into an immutable ImmutablePersonState. It composes the three focused in‑host initialiser interfaces DefaultInHostStochasticStateInitialiser, DefaultInHostPhenomenologicalStateInitialiser and DefaultInHostMarkovStateInitialiser and supplies a default initialisePerson(ImmutablePersonState.Builder, Person, Sampler) that performs the common orchestration tasks.

Role in composition: DefaultModelBuilder implements this interface and delegates person initialisation to the default method via DefaultPersonInitialiser.super.initialisePerson(...), keeping the builder focused on composition while the default initialiser centralises the mapping from configuration to runtime state. Callers that require a different initialisation strategy may either implement an alternative interface or subclass DefaultModelBuilder and override the delegation point.

Rationale and behaviour: the default method applies demographic adjustments to the outbreak execution configuration (using ReflectionUtils.modify(X, io.github.ai4ci.config.execution.PartialDemographicAdjustment, io.github.ai4ci.abm.PersonDemographic)), initialises the person's state machine, instantiates an appropriate in‑host model via initialiseInHostModel(InHostConfiguration, ExecutionConfiguration, Optional, Sampler, int) and sets importation exposure using values from the supplied SetupConfiguration. Keeping this orchestration in one place reduces duplication and makes it straightforward to evolve the initialisation contract.

Author:
Rob Challen

  • Method Details

    • initialiseInHostModel

      default <CFG extends InHostConfiguration> InHostModelState<CFG> initialiseInHostModel(CFG config, ExecutionConfiguration execConfig, Optional<PersonDemographic> person, Sampler rng, int time)
      Generic dispatcher that creates an in‑host model instance appropriate to the provided configuration.

      This method inspects the runtime type of the supplied InHostConfiguration and forwards to the corresponding specialised initialiser. It keeps the initialisation code in a single place so that the initialisePerson(io.github.ai4ci.abm.ImmutablePersonState.Builder, io.github.ai4ci.abm.Person, io.github.ai4ci.util.Sampler) method need only call a single entry point when creating the in‑host component of the person state.

      Implementers of additional in‑host model types should add an appropriate branch here or extend the dispatch mechanism to use a registry if more dynamic behaviour is required.

      Type Parameters:
      CFG - concrete in‑host configuration type
      Parameters:
      config - the in‑host configuration instance
      execConfig - the (possibly demographic adjusted) execution configuration
      person - optional person demographic used when applying demographic adjustments
      rng - sampler used to draw distributional entries
      time - current simulation time used for time‑dependent initialisation
      Returns:
      an InHostModelState instance suitable for the supplied config
      Throws:
      RuntimeException - if the configuration type is not recognised

    • initialisePerson

      default io.github.ai4ci.abm.ImmutablePersonState initialisePerson(io.github.ai4ci.abm.ImmutablePersonState.Builder builder, Person person, Sampler rng)
      Convert a baselined Person into an immutable runtime ImmutablePersonState.

      Key steps performed by the default implementation:

      1. Adjust the outbreak ExecutionConfiguration for the individual's demographic group using ReflectionUtils.modify(X, io.github.ai4ci.config.execution.PartialDemographicAdjustment, io.github.ai4ci.abm.PersonDemographic).
      2. Obtain the SetupConfiguration and compute an importation exposure probability using SetupConfiguration.getInitialImports() and the network size (this implements a simple uniform seeding strategy).
      3. Set simple per‑person modifiers (transmissibility, mobility, compliance, susceptibility, app use) to conservative defaults. These may be adjusted by downstream mechanisms or policies.
      4. Create the in‑host model instance by delegating to initialiseInHostModel(InHostConfiguration, ExecutionConfiguration, Optional, Sampler, int) which dispatches to the specific in‑host initialisers based on the concrete configuration type.
      5. Set importation exposure and initial immunisation dose.

      Configuration driven behaviour: behaviour is governed by the outbreak's execution and setup configuration. Demographic adjustments derived from ExecutionConfiguration.getDemographicAdjustment() can change sampled values for distributions and therefore alter the realised per‑person initial state. The importation exposure is derived from SetupConfiguration.getInitialImports() and SetupConfiguration.getNetwork().

      Extension guidance: implementers that wish to alter only the in‑host initialiser should implement one of the specialised DefaultInHost...Initialiser interfaces; larger changes to the person initialisation orchestration can be achieved by subclassing DefaultModelBuilder and overriding the delegation point. Avoid heavy IO in this method; if expensive per‑person computation is required prefer to precompute aggregates during outbreak baselining.

      Parameters:
      builder - the person state builder to populate
      person - the person to initialise (must have a baselined state)
      rng - a random sampler used for stochastic choices
      Returns:
      the initialised ImmutablePersonState
